DataElement.preferredName: Dental Dam Present Dental Pulp Capping Yes or No Response
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A thin sheet of rubber that is fitted over the mouth and perforated to expose certain teeth that acts as a moisture barrier during dental procedures. Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time. Application of a protective agent to an exposed pulp (direct capping) or the remaining thin layer of dentin over a nearly exposed pulp (indirect capping) in order to allow the pulp to recover and maintain its normal vitality and function. A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dental Dam Present Dental Pulp Capping
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A thin sheet of rubber that is fitted over the mouth and perforated to expose certain teeth that acts as a moisture barrier during dental procedures. Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time. Application of a protective agent to an exposed pulp (direct capping) or the remaining thin layer of dentin over a nearly exposed pulp (indirect capping) in order to allow the pulp to recover and maintain its normal vitality and function.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A thin sheet of rubber that is fitted over the mouth and perforated to expose certain teeth that acts as a moisture barrier during dental procedures.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A thin sheet of rubber that is fitted over the mouth and perforated to expose certain teeth that acts as a moisture barrier during dental procedures.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Property.preferredDefinition: Application of a protective agent to an exposed pulp (direct capping) or the remaining thin layer of dentin over a nearly exposed pulp (indirect capping) in order to allow the pulp to recover and maintain its normal vitality and function.

Concepts.definition: The application of a barrier substance to either the dentin or the dental pulp of a tooth which protects the tooth from contact with oral contaminants. This allows for recovery and restoration of the dental pulp.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
